body_html: I think it's still simpler to have workers poll the main process if they time out on the queue. As you said, it's easy on Linux because their ppid becomes 1, but I'm pretty sure that there's a Windows API that given their real ppid will tell you whether the process is alive or not.

body: I think it's still simpler to have workers poll the main process if they time out on the queue. As you said, it's easy on Linux because their `ppid` becomes `1`, but I'm pretty sure that there's a Windows API that given their real `ppid` will tell you whether the process is alive or not.
